topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Troubleshooting the VSA

body.p: You can use this guide to help you identify and resolve basic problems you may be experiencing with VSA. It contains following troubleshooting scenarios:
body.section:
Boot from volume fails if you are using a separate iSCSI network.
Description: When using a separate iSCSI network, if that network is not associated with the controllers (now using the force_network_groups option) then boot from the volumes would fail (Cinder post installation troubleshooting)

dd
Description: If the VSA cluster name is not defined correctly or using the wrong VSA cluster name/IP then cinder volume creation will fail
Resolution:
Perform the following steps:
Using the following command, login to CMC console./opt/HP/StoreVirtual/UI/jre/bin/java -jar /opt/HP/StoreVirtual/UI/UI.jar
Enter the login credentials to login to Management Group.
Click Log In. The following page is displayed:
Click mgmt1 on the left hand side of the HP Store Virtual Centralized Management Console screen.
